channel.title: Data Structures on Need For Code
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on Need For Code

item.title: Data Structures
item.description: Types Linear: order is maintained. Ex: Array, LinkedList, Stack, Queue. Non-Linear: Ex: Trees, Graph Arrays Features Collection of elements. Also called with names Vectors, Tuples. One dimensional array Two dimensional array Homogenous (all elements are of same type) Ordered Types of Arrays Static Arrays (fixed size) Have O(1) insertion, deletion and reading. Easy to implement. Dynamic Arrays (grow in size as array grows) Flexible in size Perforamance as cost for flexibility Complext to implement than fixed array.
